p: In regards to the provision of care to PD patients, consensuses pointed to the shortage of specialized movement disorders’ clinics in the region and a very low number of movement disorder specialists. This conclusion is in line with data obtained from a previously conducted survey by our Task Force [ 11] and is also reflected by the low numbers of MDS members from the MENASA countries ( Table 1). This is also consistent with the WHO Neurology atlas of country resources for neurological disorders that reported the lack of consultant neurologists in Africa [ 53], and similar reports by Khalifa et al. [ 54] in the Arab region.
